VLIB Data Structures

Here are the data structures with brief descriptions:
CORBFeatureStructure defining a feature (Used by FAST and ORB functions)
CORBInputStructure defining the ORB Input (input buffers containing data needed for various stages of ORB)
CORBOrientationOffsetsStructure containing automatically computed offset information needed by VLIB_ORB_computeOrientation
CORBOutputStructure defining the ORB (and aFast) output (number and list of features found)
CORBParametersStructure defining various parameters required by the ORB functions
CORBPatternsStructure containing automatically computed pattern information needed by VLIB_ORB_computeRBrief
RotationMatrix
sBuffer_tContainer which holds a buffer pointer and its associated memory layout information for each buffer used in functions which end in "_tile"
vlib_blobStructure defining the parameters of each blob
vlib_blobAnalysis_boxStructure defining the characteristics of a minimal enclosed rectangle
vlib_blobAnalysis_circleStructure defining the characteristics of a minimal enclosed circle
vlib_blobAnalysis_pointStructure defining the x and y coordinates of a point/pixel
vlib_blobListStructure defining common parameters for all the blobs of a image and the pointer to blob parameter array
VLIB_HAARDETOBJ_sClassifierThis structure holds property of all the stages in the classifier. Each stage is a group of trees. Each stage also have one Threshold to decide to go to next stage or not. You can visualize it as a series of trees and then you have milestones placed at predefined location. At those locations you make decision of continuing further or aborting. The categorization of these trees in multiple parts is actually stages
VLIB_HAARDETOBJ_sObjectListThis structure holds object list information
VLIB_HAARDETOBJ_sRectDefines each feature-rectangle's property from base location. Base location is the top left location of probable object patch. E.g if the base location is (x,y) then feature rectangle will be placed at (x + offsetTL, y + offsetTR). Hence as base location changes, feature-rectangle property remains same
VLIB_HAARDETOBJ_sTreeThis structure holds property of one tree. Each tree has maximum VLIB_HAARDETOBJ_MAX_NODE_PER_TREE (3) number of nodes and each node can have maximum VLIB_HAARDETOBJ_MAX_RECT_PER_NODE (3) rectangles. Each rectangle is associated with weight to it. Each node will have a threshold (referred as alpha here) to compare with. There are VLIB_HAARDETOBJ_MAX_NODE_PER_TREE (3) number of conditions checks in a tree and the bit packed result of these condition checks can be used to select one of the tree score from 'result[]'. It might be required to put some duplicate elements in 'results' to have desire result for each bit packed index
vlib_kalmanFilter_1x2_F32Structure defining the state of the Kalman filter for the F32, 4x12 (4-Dimension Observation x 12-Dimension State Vectors) variant
vlib_kalmanFilter_2x4Structure defining the state of the Kalman filter, 2x4 (2-Dimension Observation x 4-Dimension State Vectors) variant
vlib_kalmanFilter_2x4_F32Structure defining the state of the Kalman filter for the F32, 2x4 (2-Dimension Observation x 4-Dimension State Vectors) variant
vlib_kalmanFilter_2x4_S16_F32Structure defining the state of the Kalman filter for the S16_F32, 2x4 (2-Dimension Observation x 4-Dimension State Vectors) variant
vlib_kalmanFilter_4x12_F32Structure defining the state of the Kalman filter for the F32, 4x12 (4-Dimension Observation x 12-Dimension State Vectors) variant
vlib_kalmanFilter_4x6Structure defining the state of the Kalman filter, 4x6 (4-Dimension Observation x 6-Dimension State Vectors) variant
vlib_kalmanFilter_4x6_F32Structure defining the state of the Kalman filter for the F32, 4x6 (4-Dimension Observation x 6-Dimension State Vectors) variant
vlib_kalmanFilter_4x6_S16_F32Structure defining the state of the Kalman filter for the S16_F32, 4x6 (4-Dimension Observation x 6-Dimension State Vectors) variant
vlib_kalmanFilter_4x8_F32Structure defining the state of the Kalman filter for the F32, 4x8 (4-Dimension Observation x 8-Dimension State Vectors) variant
